cross-chain deposits and redemptions  Flow Examples:  1. Deposit Asset (Spoke \u2192 Hub):    User on Arbitrum \u2192 AssetOFT.send() \u2192 Hub Composer    \u2192 vault.deposit() \u2192 ShareOFT.send() \u2192 User on Arbitrum  2. Redeem Shares (Spoke \u2192 Hub):    User on Optimism \u2192 ShareOFT.send() \u2192 Hub Composer    \u2192 vault.redeem() \u2192 AssetOFT.send() \u2192 User on Optimism  3. Cross-chain Deposit:    User on Arbitrum (Asset) \u2192 User on Optimism (Shares)    AssetOFT(Arbitrum) \u2192 Composer(Hub) \u2192 ShareOFT(Optimism)  Compatible with: - ERC-4626 vaults (EagleOVault) - LayerZero OFT standard - Synchronous vault operations (immediate deposit/redeem)","errors":{"ERC4626ExceededMaxDeposit(address,uint256,uint256)":[{"details":"Attempted to deposit more assets than params._assetAmount: The number of ERC20 tokens to deposit and send
params._sendParam: Parameters on how to send the shares to the recipient

handleCompose(address,bytes32,bytes,uint.details: This function can only be called by the contract itself (self-call restriction)      Decodes the compose message to extract SendParam and minimum message value      Routes to either deposit or redeem flow based on the input OFT token type

params._amount: The amount of tokens received in the lzReceive associated with this lzTx
params._composeFrom: The bytes32 identifier of the compose sender
params._composeMsg: The encoded message containing SendParam and minMsgValue
params._oftIn: The OFT token whose funds have been received in the lzReceive associated with this lzTx

lzCompose(address,bytes32,bytes,address,.details: This composer is designed to handle refunds to an EOA address and not a contractAny revert in handleCompose() causes a refund back to the src EXCEPT for InsufficientMsgValue

params._composeSender: The OFT contract address used for refunds, must be either ASSET_OFT or SHARE_OFT
params._guid: LayerZero's unique tx id (created on the source tx)

quoteSend(address,address,uint256,(uint3.details: Revert on slippage will be thrown by the OFT and not _assertSlippageThis function can be overridden to implement custom quoting logic

params._from: The "sender address" used for the quote
params._sendParam: The parameters for the send operation
params._targetOFT: The OFT contract address to quote
params._vaultInAmount: The amount of tokens to send to the vault

returns._0: MessagingFee The estimated fee for the send operation

params._refundAddress: Address to receive excess payment of the LZ fees
params._sendParam: Parameter that defines how to send the assets
params._shareAmount: The number of vault shares to redeem

depositAndSend(uint256,(uint32,bytes32,u.notice: Deposits ERC20 assets from the caller into the vault and sends them to the recipient

handleCompose(address,bytes32,bytes,uint.notice: Handles the compose operation for OFT (Omnichain Fungible Token) transactions

lzCompose(address,bytes32,bytes,address,.notice: Handles LayerZero compose operations for vault transactions with automatic refund functionality

quoteSend(address,address,uint256,(uint3.notice: Quotes the send operation for the given OFT and SendParam

redeemAndSend(uint256,(uint32,bytes32,ui.notice: Redeems vault shares and sends the resulting assets to the user
